alert.note: Alert for Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Imperial County Southeast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 08 at 11:05AM PST until December 09 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...North winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * WHERE...Chuckwalla Mountains, Southeastern Imperial County and Chiriaco Summit. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to noon PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Imperial County Southeast
